intro: Euphrasia costeana var. ramosa, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and oval-shaped, and it produces numerous stamens that give it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
